is a short drive to Nelspruit town.

The airport is well developed, with ATMs, cafes, souvenir shops and several car rental desks.

. From Komatipoort you can take a Mozambiquan train east to

.

The train station is at the corner of Andrew and Henshall streets.

Travel around Nelspruit by car and get an eyefull of the beautiful scenery and meandering mountain passes. The area is still quite wild and while you are driving around at your leisure, you may view small game and even some vervet monkeys and baboons.

value: content=Offers helicopter tours, rides and trips in the Nelspruit and Mpumalanga area, including Kruger Park and other game reserves.
Panoramic view from a hilltop of Nelspruit

There are few attractions in Nelspruit itself, but the surrounding towns and area can make for an interesting drive.

value: . It has a tropical atmosphere. It's on the road to

before you get to the casino.  Has several loop walks, bridges and waterfalls with several interpretive signs.  There is a cost of admission, and like in many part of South Africa a tip for the car minders.  It can feel quiet and isolated, and there is no real security to speak of.
Try your luck at the casino.

There are three large shopping malls in Nelspruit, and like most of South Africa they are security patrolled.  However, they are not open in the evenings.

value: directions=From the N4, turn into Daan Pienaar/White River Road (R40) towards White River. Follow this road for about 5km and the mall will be on your right.
hoursextra=Open F until 7PM on Su and holidays until 3PM

Nelspruit can be used as base for visitors touring the
and the nearby sights, like the

. There is a range of accommodation available here, but there is also a similar range near some of the Kruger gates like at Crocodile Gate and at Phalaborwa, which may be more suited to touring the park.

value: directions=On the N4, 20 km west of Nelspruit
directions=12 km west of Nelspruit on the N4

content=Accommodation lies within the huge, peaceful garden with acres of lawn creating wide open space.  Large parking area and good security. All rooms, rondavels, regular bedrooms and cabins have bathrooms en suite, as well as heaters and fans.  Several are equipped with tea/coffee facilities, fridge, television and microwave.

It is not safe to walk around Nelspruit after dark.  There are lots of traffic lights in Nelspruit, and vendors and beggars will approach your car when you are stopped.  Keep your car doors locked at all times, and consider whether you may find dinner at your accommodation more pleasant than driving a distance through Nelspruit after dark.
